  • Method Details

    • getThread

      public Thread getThread​(int threadId, String username)
      Gets a thread from the perspective of user. This is needed to determine whether the thread should be marked as a tagged thread or a thread viewed under other conditions.

      The distinction is necessary to determine if the prompt should include an option to kill the thread. Threads posted on other friends walls are included in one's news feed, but the user should not be able to kill (delete or untag) the thread in this situation.

      Parameters:
      threadId - The thread id.
      username - The username of the user retrieving the thread.
      Returns:
      The thread.

    • getNewsFeedThreads

      public List<Thread> getNewsFeedThreads​(String username, int limit)
      Retrieves a list of latest threads on a user's news feed.

      News feed threads include the union of all latest threads on the current user's wall and threads posted to the current user's friends, not including any gift threads.

      Parameters:
      username - The user whose news feed to load.
      limit - The number of latest posts to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A list of threads to be displayed on the news feed.
      See Also:
      getWallThreads(String, int)

    • getWallThreads

      public List<Thread> getWallThreads​(String username, int limit)
      Retrieves a list of latest threads on a user's wall.

      Wall threads include:

      • Non-gift threads by the current user.
      • Threads to the current user's wall, including City Farmer gifts.
      • Threads with the current user tagged.

      Parameters:
      username - The user whose wall to load.
      limit - The number of latest posts to retrieve.
      Returns:
      Posts to be displayed on the wall.
